intro: Fridericia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia fridericia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
